reviews.review_msg: Dr. Guttman is a good lecturer and explains the concepts well, he's pretty entertaining too. But you have to attend lecture to get the notes, he doesnt record them. Tests are all multiple choice which can be difficult, I would have appreciated some short answer questions on the final. A 160 MC final is insane but doable if you study constantly.

Guttman is an ok prof not good not bad. You have two midterms and a final that full cumulative all mc. He doesn't record is lecture and you need to fill in the blanks so you have to show up but he is kind of entreating. If you want a good mark start studying day one and you should be fine dont try to cram on the last day unless you want to do bad.

No tutorials or assignments. just 2 midterms all pure memorization and a cumulative final exam that i still gotta write. Great guy but it is legit all memorization. Content heavy and you gotta attend class to fill in the blanks in the notes. He is really great and accessible. Make cue cards after every lecture otherwise you may fall behind.

Julian's a very engaging and fun lecturer, I always enjoyed coming to his class. 428 was extremely content heavy and you cannot miss any lectures. I suggest making friends to share notes and voice record lectures as he will test on things he says that aren't in the notes. The cumulative final is killer so review EVERYTHING (including figures).

Keep up with every lecture every day and you'll do well. He covers a lot in lecture, so it's crucial to not cram at the last minute. 100% multiple choice, midterms are non-cumulative, final is cumulative. Memorize everything from lecture.
I don't recommend taking it with four other courses, but this is the most straightforward course I have taken.
Dr. Guttman is caring and gives amazing lectures. You could tell he is really passionate about his work. I would highly recommend!
